business.headline: Infosys lets go of 240 new recruits, offers free upskilling: ReportThe impacted employees joined the company in October 2024 as part of a training batch. The freshers were hired for two roles; System Engineers (SE) and Digital Specialist Engineers (DSE).

Nvidia to keep serving Chinese firms despite massive AI chip export lossHuang's statement comes at a time when the United States has tightened rules around exporting advanced chips to China. The restrictions, announced under the Donald Trump administration, are part of an ongoing trade war between the two countries.

Want to change your tax regime while filing ITR? Here's what you should knowLet's say you had earlier chosen the old tax regime, but now the new regime appears more beneficial after reviewing your finances. Can you change it when filing your ITR? Let's find out here.

TCS denies job bias against US employees, calls allegations 'misleading': ReportThe complaints have mostly come from workers in the US who are over 40 and not of non-South Asian ethnic backgrounds. They believe TCS chose them for layoffs during the tech industry slowdown, while keeping younger Indian workers on H-1B visas.

How Jaggi brothers squandered borrowed money, killed BluSmartSebi's interim order exposed how the Jaggi brothers may have taken investors for a ride, not in an EV, but in a web of financial mismanagement.
Can you open two PPF accounts? Check detailsThe combined yearly deposit in both your PPF account and that of your child's account cannot go beyond Rs 1.5 lakh.

Trump started the tariff war. Now a weak dollar has him on the back footAs Trump's tariff strategy faces mounting challenges, a weakening dollar and rising inflation threaten to undermine his economic goals, forcing the US into a precarious position as global trade tensions escalate.

IMF backs India's stance on tariffs, presses US-China on fair tradeAmid rising global tensions, the IMF sees India's moves on tariffs as a rare bright spot, urging the world's largest economies to rebuild trust and strengthen a fair trade system.

Life insurance claim rejected? Here's how to get it correctGetting an insurance claim approved has become a nightmare nowadays. Nithin Kamath, in a post, also said that many avoid life insurance because policies as they are confusing and getting harder to understand.

Good Friday 2025: Are Sensex and Nifty closed for trading today?This week has been a short one for stock market participants. The markets opened only for three days, from April 15 to April 17. They were shut on Monday, April 14, in observance of Dr. Baba Saheb Ambedkar Jayanti.

Thumbay International Research Grant awards 14 projects at Gulf Medical UniversityThe 14 selected projects, led by top researchers from institutions like Harvard Medical School, University of Arizona, and Regensburg University, were chosen for their exceptional quality and originality.

Trump's tariffs could hurt US, but an opportunity for India: Ruchir SharmaRuchir Sharma believes India's emerging role in global trade could reshape its economic future, with a potential influx of investment as the US faces trade challenges and shifts in global capital flows.

entertainment.headline: Kesari 2 review: Akshay Kumar leads India's humble roar for apology in important filmReleased-Fri Apr 18, 2025'Kesari Chapter 2' tells you that you've mourned enough. Set in the aftermath of the Jallianwala Bagh massacre, the Akshay Kumar-led film stirs your emotions by demanding an apology from the British Empire that is due for over 106 years.

BTS Jin announces debut solo world tour: Everything you need to knowBTS member Jin is set to launch a solo world tour following his new album 'Echo'. The tour will start in South Korea this June and cover multiple countries.
Kull teaser: Nimrat Kaur, Ridhi Dogra star in a tale of betrayal, mind gamesNimrat Kaur and Ridhi Dogra starrer 'Kull' teaser is out. The JioHotstar Special will premiere on May 2.

Jaat director Gopichand Malineni reacts to online trolling amid controversy'Jaat' director Gopchant Malineni, in an exclusive interview with India Today, spoke about actors being subjected to online trolling amid the film's ongoing controversy. He shared his views on the film's sequel.

Actors Trisha, Simbu discuss reuniting for Thug Life after 15 years. WatchActors Trisha and Simbu have reunited for Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life'. The two, who worked in 'Vinnaithaandi Varuvaayaa', are coming together after 15 years.

Jaideep Ahlawat on comparisons with Irrfan: It's a very personal feeling | ExclusiveJaideep Ahlawat, in an exclusive interview, shares his thoughts on being compared to the late Irrfan, expressing a mix of honour and responsibility while discussing his role in the upcoming Netflix film, 'Jewel Thief.'

Mizuki Itagaki, Japanese actor missing for 3 months, found dead at 24Japanese actor Mizuki Itagaki, who had been missing for three months, has been found dead at the age of 24. The family shared the news in a statement.

Sister Midnight: Radhika Apte's new poster out, fans are reminded of Taxi DriverThe makers of the upcoming film 'Sister Midnight' unveiled an intriguing poster of actor Radhika Apte. Excited fans quickly noted the resemblance to the poster of the 1976 hit 'Taxi Driver'.

Kamal Haasan says Mani Ratnam reminds him of K Balachander at Thug Life eventKamal Haasan, speaking at the 'Thug Life' event in Chennai, spoke about his association with director Mani Ratnam. He said that Ratnam's work style reminds him of his guru and legendary Tamil director, K Balachander.

Sinners review: Michael B Jordan's twin engine roars loud in this gripping vampire dramaReleased-Fri Apr 18, 2025Sinners movie review: Michael B Jordan delivers a captivating performance in Ryan Coogler's 'Sinners,' where he plays the Smokestack twins in a 1930s vampire drama. Coogler creates a suspenseful and dramatic narrative enriched with music and unexpected twists, says our review.

Ibrahim Ali Khan, Rasha Thadani enjoy IPL match together, Veer Pahariya joinsActors Ibrahim Ali Khan and Rasha Thadani were clicked together, enjoying the IPL match in Mumbai. They were also joined by Veer Pahariya.

Malayalam actor retracts complaint against Shine Tom Chacko, requests anonymityMalayalam actor Vincy Aloshious has reportedly decided to withdraw her complaint against fellow actor Shine Tom Chacko. She had accused her co-star of using drugs on set and misbehaving with her.

Liked Adolescence? Telugu film Court has important message, pertinent in IndiaIf you liked Netflix's 'Adolescence', which talked about teenage sexuality and alpha male syndrome, here's a Telugu film, Court: State vs A Nobody, that talks about the POCSO Act.

Namrata Shirodkar, children enjoy Nick Jonas's show, Priyanka sends loveMahesh Babu's wife and former actor Namrata Shirodkar enjoyed watching Nick Jonas' Broadway show, The Last Five Years. Priyanka Chopra reacted to their lovable message after the show.

Vicky Kaushal, Huma Qureshi, celebs in awe of Akshay's Kesari 2: Absolute magicA star-studded screening for Akshay Kumar's 'Kesari Chapter 2' was hosted by the makers on Thursday. Celebs including Vicky Kaushal, Huma Qureshi, Avneet Kaur and Nandish Sandhu, among others, praised the film, calling it 'absolute magic'.

Tamil actor, MIA after posting explicit content, found undergoing medical careTamil actor Sri alias Shriram Natarajan, who had gone missing for the past few days, is currently under medical care, a statement issued by director Lokesh Kanagaraj read. His family and friends were looking out for him after he posted explicit videos on Instagram.

Kajol rolls her eyes, looks visibly irked by paps at Kesari 2 screening. WatchKajol was visibly irked by the paparazzi, who were shouting while she was posing with Ananya Panday at 'Kesari 2' screening. She asked them to 'calm down'.

Jaat box office Day 8: Sunny Deol's 'dhai kilo ka haath' wins audience in 1st weekSunny Deol's 'Jaat' continues to move at a decent pace at the box office even amid a fresh controversy involving Christian community members claiming that a scene in the film hurt their religious sentiments. The film has finished its first week's run.

Jaat movie scene stirs row, case against Sunny Deol, Randeep HoodaA man in Jalandhar has filed a case against Sunny Deol, Randeep Hooda and Vineet Kumar Siingh, among others from the 'Jaat' team, for hurting religious sentiments.

general news.headline: PM speaks to Elon Musk ahead of Tesla's India entry, discusses tech, innovationPM Modi and Elon Musk discussed a wide range of topics, building upon their earlier meeting in Washington DC earlier this year. The conversation highlighted the growing synergy between India's rapidly evolving tech ecosystem and Musk's ventures in cutting-edge innovation.

US ultimatum on Russia-Ukraine peace deal: Will move on if no progress madeUS Secretary of State Marco Rubio warned that peace efforts between Russia and Ukraine may be halted soon if no progress is seen.

Focus on own minorities: India slams Bangladesh over Bengal riots remarkIndia's strong remarks come a day after Bangladesh called on Indian authorities to protect minority Muslim communities affected by the violence in Bengal.

Trump is striking at the very idea of Harvard, its international studentsPresident Donald Trump is out with a sledgehammer and striking at the very core of Harvard University, an institution older than the USA. Harvard has been synonymous with American education, politics and society. The reason why Harvard is world-class is that it attracts the world's best brains. That's what Trump is seeking to pull the plug on.

SC's judicial overreach? Vice President joins experts with fierce criticismVice President Jagdeep Dhankhar fiercely criticised the Supreme Court's judgment that set deadlines for the President to clear Bills passed by state Assemblies and its use of extraordinary powers under Article 142. Dhankhar joined a growing voice of critics who see the SC's landmark Tamil Nadu case judgment as a case of judicial overreach.
KL Rahul, Athiya Shetty reveal name of daughter. Meaning explainedKL Rahul and Athiya Shetty have revealed the name of their daughter. The duo have named their child Evaarah Vipula Rahul.

Secret hobby helped in first woman astronaut's safe return after 3 days in spaceSixty years before pop star Katy Perry's 10-minute spaceflight, a factory worker from the Soviet Union created history, becoming the first woman in space. In 1963, Valentina Tereshkova, who worked in textile and tyre factories, went into space on a solo mission that lasted three days. Tereshkova's secret hobby helped her land back safely after orbiting the earth 48 times.

Indian-American man shot dead in Chicago parkKevin Patel, a 28-year-old Indian-American man, was shot in the chest in Chicago's Lincoln Park and later died in the hospital. The Chicago Police have not identified any person or taken suspects into custody yet.

Himachal top bureaucrat's Holi bash cost Rs 1.22 lakh, he asks government to payHimachal Pradesh chief secretary's Holi party has sparked outrage among retired IAS officers, who are questioning the use of taxpayer money for a 'personal event'.

Woman kills husband, shows body to lover on video call in Madhya PradeshAfter the victim's body was found with multiple injuries, suspicion quickly fell on his wife, who had been missing since the night of the murder.

Inside Cambridge's elite brothel scandal that got Indian-origin CEO trappedBehind luxury condos and Harvard's shadow was an elite brothel for the ultrarich, complete with background checks for a USD 600-an-hour 'girlfriend experience'. An Indian-origin CEO is among its long list of patrons that includes doctors, lawyers and entrepreneurs of the Massachusetts-based sex-service network.

Pregnant woman's 'just for fun' question to ChatGPT saves her life and unborn child'sIn an Instagram post, content creator Natallia Tarrien said that she had asked a question to ChatGPT "just for fun" about mild jaw tightness which ultimately led to the emergency delivery of her baby and, according to doctors, likely saved her life.

Japan's move will also pave the way for future production of bullet trains under the 'Make in India' scheme.

New study flips the script: Marriage may raise dementia riskClaims that marriage has a positive effect on your mental health are up for challenge as the new study by researchers at Florida State University suggests that people who are unmarried, whether never married or divorced, may actually have a lower risk of developing dementia than their married counterparts.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
